list_definition.definition: a person employed to write letters, keep records and make business arrangements etc for another person

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He dictated a letter to his secretary.

list_definition.definition: a (sometimes unpaid) person who deals with the official business of an organization etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The secretary read out the minutes of the society’s last meeting.

list_ex_of_english: Elected village chiefs increasingly resist party secretary control over village economic associations, and demand the right to control the village economy.
The presiding officer and the secretary or clerk are present, and clustered around them is a small group of members.
As a result, party secretaries now consult more with the village committee.
Before 1963 there was no full-time manager, administrative duties being handled by a secretary and volunteers who staffed the headquarters and the clinics.
Not once do we hear from them directly, but only about their degraded state from clergymen, physicians, and secretaries of burial and benefit clubs.
Membership was confined to the regional commissioner, rural development officer, zonal rural development officer, regional technical officers and the administrative secretary.
This is further confirmed by the case of the secretaries working in the central police stations of the city.
The regulations also made provisions for supernumerary secretary positions.
